core.compoundterm
Class Plug

java.lang.Object
  core.compoundterm.CompoundTerm
      core.compoundterm.Plug

public class Plug
extends CompoundTerm

Plug class define the plugging operator introduced in the connector algebra theory. This is a binary operator: result of application is new term composed by two components terms. The operator connects two terms of the algebra on common message ports; during composition, if the two terms share same message port, more specifically one term consumes from an uri and the other term send exchange to the same uri, we connects directly the two term.This is equivalent to plugging the corresponding IA into each other, or potentially synchronising them.

Author:
giacomolm

Constructor Detail

Plug

public Plug(CompoundTerm c1,
            CompoundTerm c2)
Build new Plug term starting from c1, c2 compound terms. The two terms are simply added to build this compound terms.

Method Detail

start

public void start()
This method simply start component terms of this compound term. If this term is the outer (it is not a component of another term), we must publish associated port.

Overrides:
start in class CompoundTerm

setMessage

public void setMessage(java.lang.String uri,
                       org.apache.camel.Exchange e)
Set the received exchange e received by this main term as input of the two contained terms.

Specified by:
setMessage in class CompoundTerm
Parameters:

e - exchange received
